ticket.title: Polymorphic Associations & STI don't record the correct model type
ticket.original-body:
When using a polymorphic association on a model that uses STI, the correct model type is not recorded.
This has been identified before and is actually fixed with the patch here by removing instances of base_class: http://dev.rubyonrails.org/attachment/ticket/6485/polymorphic_sti_associations_rails21.patch
Is there a reason that this cannot be applied?
ticket.latest-body:
When using a polymorphic association on a model that uses STI, the correct model type is not recorded.
This has been identified before and is actually fixed with the patch here by removing instances of base_class: http://dev.rubyonrails.org/attachment/ticket/6485/polymorphic_sti_associations_rails21.patch
Is there a reason that this cannot be applied?
ticket.original-body-html:
When using a polymorphic association on a model that uses STI, the correct model type is not recorded.

This has been identified before and is actually fixed with the patch here by removing instances of base_class:

http://dev.rubyonrails.org/attac...

Is there a reason that this cannot be applied?

I believed it uggs classic cardy was a simple topic with a very simple proposition. With a firm belief in myself, I tried to pen a few bailey button fancy words. I found myself helpless as I had fiddled away precious bailey button uggs time. Apparently an innocuous proposition made me ponder, which began in a cheap ugg boots argyle listless way and later took a definite direction.As my thought process gained some classic argyle knit ugg boots ground, I could not fathom the depth of this topic nor scale the uggs mini height of it. At one time I thought it could be dealt by filling the write up with anecdotes of my short mini uggs life and thus proving Life is Beautiful. The very next instance made me shudder, as a serious ugg boots ultra topic should be dealt philosophically. A chain developed with one approach giving way to the other.As we grew old ugg ultra tall boots sale together, I would tease you that you had not changed since we first met. But it is true, my uggs tall women darling. I do not see the wrinkles and grey hair that other people see. When I look at you ugg black classic tall sale now, I only see your sweet tender lips and youthful sparkling eyes as we sat and had out first picnic next black short ugg to that small stream, and chased each other around ugg black short that big old oak tree. I remember wishing those sundance ugg boots first few days together would last forever. Do you remember how exciting and wonderful those chestnut ugg boots nightfall days were? ZHC

version.title: Polymorphic Associations & STI don't record the correct model type

version.body:
I'm currently using Rails 2.3.8 and the resource_type on the STI/Polymorphic table isn't being set. BTW, I have the following construction:
D belongs_to :resource, :polymorphic => true
A has_many :groups, :as => :resource, :dependent => :destroy B has_many :groups, :as => :resource, :dependent => :destroy C has_many :groups, :as => :resource, :dependent => :destroy
Note: The D model is both polymorphic and the STI bass class.
Anyway, I'm wondering, if I'm missing a step somewhere and/or this patch hasn't been applied to the 2.3.8?
version.body-html:
I'm currently using Rails 2.3.8 and the resource_type on the STI/Polymorphic table isn't being set. BTW, I have the following construction:

D belongs_to :resource, :polymorphic => true

A has_many :groups, :as => :resource, :dependent => :destroy
B has_many :groups, :as => :resource, :dependent => :destroy
C has_many :groups, :as => :resource, :dependent => :destroy

Note: The D model is both polymorphic and the STI bass class.

Anyway, I'm wondering, if I'm missing a step somewhere and/or this patch hasn't been applied to the 2.3.8?
version.title: Polymorphic Associations & STI don't record the correct model type
